In the consulship of L. Aemilius immense bands of Gauls orossed the Alps, but the whole of Italy united with Rome, and Fabius the historian, who took part in this war, writes that eight hundred thousand men were levied for this campaign, which was conducted so successfully by the consul that forty thousand of the enemy were slain, and a triumph granted to Aemilius.
